titleInfo.title: 'File 7/10 Correspondence re: Duty on Mislanded Cargo'

physicalDescription.extent: This file is arranged approximately in chronological order.
The foliation sequence runs from the folio following the front cover to the back cover of the file. It appears in pencil in the top centre or top right of the recto of the folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between the British Political Agents at Bahrain and Kuwait; the Secretary and Under Secretary to the British Political Resident in the Persian Gulf at Bushire; Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, Advisor to the Bahrain Government; Claude C L de Grenier, Director of Customs and Ports Officer, Bahrain; and Deputy Manager, Mesopotamia and Persia Corporation Limited.The correspondence of 1934 (ff. 1-13) concerns the question of whether mislanded cargo at Bahrain is non-dutiable and enquiries made to the Residency at Bushire and Agency at Kuwait about procedure in those places and at Basrah (ff. 6, 8-9 and 12-13). The correspondence of 1941 concerns the auction of effects of two dead Norwegian sailors and, more generally, the auction of goods that have lain in Customs uncleared for six months or longer (f. 14).
